device-profile.mqtt-enable-compatibility-with-json-payl: Enable compatibility with other payload formats.

When enabled, the platform will use a Protobuf payload format by default. If parsing fails, the platform will attempt to use JSON payload format. Useful for backward compatibility during firmware updates. For example, the initial release of the firmware uses Json, while the new release uses Protobuf. During the process of firmware update for the fleet of devices, it is required to support both Protobuf and JSON simultaneously. The compatibility mode introduces slight performance degradation, so it is recommended to disable this mode once all devices are updated.
device-profile.mqtt-use-json-format-for-default-downlin: Use Json format for default downlink topics

When enabled, the platform will use Json payload format to push attributes and RPC via the following topics: v1/devices/me/attributes/response/$request_id, v1/devices/me/attributes, v1/devices/me/rpc/request/$request_id, v1/devices/me/rpc/response/$request_id. This setting does not impact attribute and rpc subscriptions sent using new (v2) topics: v2/a/res/$request_id, v2/a, v2/r/req/$request_id, v2/r/res/$request_id. Where $request_id is an integer request identifier.
device-profile.mqtt-send-ack-on-validation-exception: Send PUBACK on PUBLISH message validation failure
device-profile.mqtt-send-ack-on-validation-exception-hi: By default, the platform will close the MQTT session on message validation failure. When enabled, the platform will send publish acknowledgment instead of closing the session.

binding-type.u: U: Client is reachable via the UDP binding at any time.
binding-type.m: M: Client is reachable via the MQTT binding at any time.
binding-type.h: H: Client is reachable via the HTTP binding at any time.
binding-type.t: T: Client is reachable via the TCP binding at any time.
binding-type.s: S: Client is reachable via the SMS binding at any time.
binding-type.n: N: Client MUST send the response to such a request over the Non-IP binding (is supported since LWM2M 1.1).
binding-type.uq: UQ: UDP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.uqs: UQS: both UDP and SMS connections active; UDP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tq: TQ: TCP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tqs: TQS: both TCP and SMS connections active; TCP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.sq: SQ: SMS connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)

lwm2m.binding-tooltip:
This is the list in the"binding" resource of the LwM2M server object - /1/x/7.
Indicates the supported binding modes in the LwM2M Client.
This value SHOULD be the same as the value in the “Supported Binding and Modes” resource in the Device Object (/3/0/16).
While multiple transports are supported, only one transport binding can be used during the entire Transport Session.
As an example, when UDP and SMS are both supported, the LwM2M Client and the LwM2M Server can choose to communicate either over UDP or SMS during the entire Transport Session.
